channel.title: [C4D] Living Room
channel.description:
This is my second attempt at a living room in C4D, i want to thank STH for helping me with VRay, as there were no tutorials anywhere.
http://img526.imageshack.us/img526/3508/roomoc1.jpg http://img398.imageshack.us/img398/2278/newroommy5.jpg
I tried balancing out the room more and make it look natural. [img]http://img391.imageshack.us/img391/4663/roomfinalvu5.jpg[/img]
CC

item.title: [C4D] Living Room
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Zameix, post:41, topic:229482”]Frell, thanks for the advice. I took a look at the spoon tut but got lost and couldn’t get the swing of it.

I’m yet to work out how to use backgrounds and stuff. I just followed a wine glass tut and this is my first c4d piece:

I added a “sky” because the background was pitch black and as I am so unfamiliar with the tools even after a couple of crash courses I didn’t know any other techniques.


any tips e,g where to go next?[/quote]
Make a separate post asking for help, so we dont hijack my thread.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Living Room
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Zameix, post:38, topic:229482”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=301884.msg2465675#msg2465675 date=1222708855]

I recently got hold of Cinema 4d and was wondering, instead of reading mindless tutorials where do you personally think I should start?

NOT all the stuff you see here. Everyone here seems to want to jump into way more complicated things.
If you’re not going to use tutorials then experiment with EVERYTHING.

And then, get out of the mindset that you make a common symbol of something and that’s what it is. This is MUCH like an art class. You draw what you SEE. NOT what a flower or whatever is. Exactly what you see.
[/quote]

I’m thinking in terms of something along the lines of what Frell produces, e.g interior rooms (without the textures)[/quote]
Tutorials are very good. But you need to take some time to experiment with the program and find everything so you can follow the tutorials better.

I jumped ahead to fast and tried a living room: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,250643.0.html
but then i set back a bit and made a few small 1 object images

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Living Room
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Zameix, post:38, topic:229482”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=301884.msg2465675#msg2465675 date=1222708855]

I recently got hold of Cinema 4d and was wondering, instead of reading mindless tutorials where do you personally think I should start?

NOT all the stuff you see here. Everyone here seems to want to jump into way more complicated things.
If you’re not going to use tutorials then experiment with EVERYTHING.

And then, get out of the mindset that you make a common symbol of something and that’s what it is. This is MUCH like an art class. You draw what you SEE. NOT what a flower or whatever is. Exactly what you see.
[/quote]

I’m thinking in terms of something along the lines of what Frell produces, e.g interior rooms (without the textures)[/quote]

No.
That’s the problem. You don’t know how to get anything done already and you set your goals high, produce a maybe mediocre image, and think it’s wonderful.

You’re better off doing tutorials.

Read full topic

I recently got hold of Cinema 4d and was wondering, instead of reading mindless tutorials where do you personally think I should start?
[/quote]
NOT all the stuff you see here. Everyone here seems to want to jump into way more complicated things.
If you’re not going to use tutorials then experiment with EVERYTHING.

And then, get out of the mindset that you make a common symbol of something and that’s what it is. This is MUCH like an art class. You draw what you SEE. NOT what a flower or whatever is. Exactly what you see.[/quote]

I’m thinking in terms of something along the lines of what Frell produces, e.g interior rooms (without the textures)

item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

NOT all the stuff you see here. Everyone here seems to want to jump into way more complicated things.
If you’re not going to use tutorials then experiment with EVERYTHING.

And then, get out of the mindset that you make a common symbol of something and that’s what it is. This is MUCH like an art class. You draw what you SEE. NOT what a flower or whatever is. Exactly what you see.

Read full topic

item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Image > Adjustments > Hue/Saturation + Filter > Render > Clouds (I couldn’t resist.) =

On topic though, I think if you did tone down the colors just a tad, it would look a lot nicer. Minus the cloud render.

item.title: [C4D] Living Room
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

It’s not about not matching or too perfect right now.
It’s just too saturated.

You won’t find stuff that’s THAT deep of a color.

And I would turn down the Color Saturation thingy in GI settings by a lot, like .3

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Living Room
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:22, topic:229482”]You’ll need MUCH more light then.

One thing you have to learn about VRay, it’s MUCH more complex than Advanced Render.

Start thinking of how to make and design things, instead of designing them to look like things.[/quote]
I used a light purple, and baby blue and white, it looks balanced out, nice pillows, and some wall decorations:

Read full topic
